Returns: str (formatted with description, JQL, placeholders, example, notes)
Use When: Need to look up JQL query template by name. Case-insensitive lookup.

Returns: str (formatted with milestone, when_to_send, data requirements, template content)
Use When: Need Slack announcement template for freeze milestones. Case-insensitive.

Returns: str (formatted with description, input, data sources, tools, output format, instructions)
Use When: Need step-by-step workflow for specific action. Case-insensitive.

Returns: str (formatted table of items in category)
Use When: Need configuration items by category (Core Principles, Jira Projects, etc.). Case-insensitive.

Returns: str (formatted with parameters, return values, usage, examples)
Use When: Need documentation for a specific tool. Case-insensitive.

Returns: str (formatted with use case, required elements, structure, examples)
Use When: Need response format specification (Detailed, Summary, etc.). Case-insensitive.

Returns: str (JSON with full issue details, comments, GitHub PR links)
Use When: Need complete details for a single issue including description and comments

Returns: str (JSON with key, summary, status only)
Use When: Need to display issues to user with minimal fields - optimized for listings

Parameters: jql_query: str, fields: str, max_results: int = 50, include_summary: bool = True
Returns: str (JSON with custom field selection)
Use When: Need issues with specific custom fields selected

Returns: str (JSON with total count + breakdown by type/status/priority)
Use When: Need total counts only - lightweight statistics without issue details

Parameters: release_version: str, team_ids: list[str], base_jql: str | None = None
Returns: str (JSON with per-team counts)
Use When: Need per-team breakdowns. ALWAYS use this for team counts (not manual counting). Optional base_jql for freeze-specific queries.

Returns: str (JSON with unique fix version names)
Use When: Need to extract unique fix version names from issues

Returns: str (JSON: {"sprint_id": "...", "sprint_name": "..."} or null)
Use When: Need to extract sprint ID and name from an issue

Returns: str (JSON with total_planned, total_closed, stories_tasks_closed, bugs_closed)
Use When: Need sprint statistics - planned vs closed, breakdown by type

Returns: str (content as markdown/CSV/txt depending on type)
Use When: Need to read Google Docs/Sheets content. Auto-detects format.

Returns: str (JSON with display_name, email, photo_link)
Use When: Need info about authenticated Google user

Returns: Total count, Jira Key/Summary (linked), Status, Priority, Assignee, Jira search link
Use When: When detailed issue information is needed - show each issue with full details
Example:
**Total:** 5 issues
â€¢ [RHIDP-123] Feature X - Status: In Progress - Priority: High - Assignee: John
[View in Jira](link)

Returns: Total count, Jira search link
Use When: When only count is needed - no issue details required

Returns: Table: Team Name, Total Issues, Jira Search Link (per team)
Use When: Team-level aggregation - show counts per team

Returns: Table: Team Name, Breakdown by type (Features, Epics, Stories, Tasks, Bugs), Links for each
Use When: Team breakdown by issue type - detailed per-team analysis
